elements.data: A cash-strapped family ranch for distressed horses is the setting for this dramatic series.
In the Season 1 premiere, Amy grieves for her mother as she helps an abused horse named Spartan.

display.subtitle2: Lou isn't pleased when a neighbouring rancher brings a pregnant mare named Melody to stay at Heartland. Lou has no intention of playing mid .
display.title: Come What May

display.subtitle2: The pressure is on when a famous race horse, Gallant Prince, is sent to Heartland to see if it can be rehabilitated. The horse has been terribly burned and injured in a highly published stable fire. Its physical scars have healed but the mental ones remain. Lou makes the mistake of talking to a reporter and soon all eyes are on Amy and her gift.
display.title: Out of the Darkness

display.subtitle2: When Lou decides to make a promotional video to advertise Heartland, nobody is very supportive of the idea. But Lou is determined, perhaps even more than usual. She manages to recruit everyone at Heartland to spruce up the ranch, including Mallory and Ben who are assigned the messy task of moving the manure pile. After Lou's big city director drops out, Lou hires Marnie's husband Jerry, a local wedding videographer to direct. But once the shooting starts, it's clear the real director is Lou.
display.title: The Best Laid Plans

display.subtitle2: Ty is haunted by the past; and Amy brings a Shetland pony to Heartland.
display.title: Ghost from the Past

display.subtitle2: Jack learns about Ty's violent past during a Mustang roundup; and Scott makes a pilgrimage to his childhood home with Lou while Amy remains at Heartland with Mallory.
display.title: Born to Run

display.subtitle2: Disaster strikes when the barn at Heartland erupts into flames and Jack is injured getting the horses to safety. Although Jack makes a quick recovery, Heartland may never be the same again after Lou discovers the barn isn't insured. Leave it to Val Stanton to use their misfortunes as an opportunity to expand Briar Ridge. With no insurance to rebuild, Jack is forced to consider Val's offer to buy part of Heartland's acreage.
display.title: Rising from the Ashes

display.subtitle2: Lou plans an open house to attract business for the farm, and discreetly invites Tim to the house.
display.title: Breaking Free

display.subtitle2: In the Season 1 finale, Amy finds herself conflicted as she trains a horse for a jumping competition while coping with her feelings for Ty; and Ty faces a tough decision now that his probation has expired.
display.title: Coming Together

display.subtitle2: Lou makes a mistake and discharges a horse before his fear of traffic has been resolved; Val Stanton spreads harmful gossip; and Amy second-guesses her abilities.
display.title: After the Storm

display.subtitle2: Amy and Lou discover a letter that enables them to have some sympathy for their father.
display.title: Taking Chances

display.subtitle2: Lou's New York boyfriend Carl, decides to pay Heartland a visit, and the question on everyone's mind is, how long is he staying? Carl has just been offered a lucrative position at a firm in Chicago, and he has come to Heartland to convince Lou to go with him. Everything seems to fall into place when Lou is offered a job at the same Chicago firm. Meanwhile, Amy and Mallory discover that Scott is secretly in love with Lou, and he's been avoiding Heartland ever since Carl's arrival.
display.title: One Trick Pony

display.subtitle2: Tensions rise for Amy and Lou after Jack lets Tim visit Heartland; Amy's bond with Tim affects Lou; and Jack seeks romantic advice from Ty.
display.title: Thicker than Water

display.subtitle2: When Amy discovers that a horse named Spartan is being abused at Mallen's farm, she convinces her mother Marion to rescue the horse and bring him back to Heartland. On the way home a raging storm sends their truck and horse trailer careening off the side of the road. When Amy wakes up in the hospital, she's forced to deal with the tragic news that her mother is dead.
display.title: Coming Home

display.subtitle2: In the Season 2 premiere, a wild mustang challenges Amy; Lou organizes a birthday party for her sister; and Mallory's parents make an appearance.
display.title: Ghost Horse

display.subtitle2: Ty returns to Heartland and sees that Caleb has filled the void he left; and Lou and Tim butt heads with Jack over plans to change the ranch.
display.title: Letting Go

display.subtitle2: Her father's gift forces Amy to make a difficult choice between a career in show jumping or her work at Heartland.
display.title: Gift Horse

display.subtitle2: The spring cattle drive kicks off, along with Lou's plan to have a secret day date with Scott.
display.title: Dancing In The Dark

display.subtitle2: Amy's work with a damaged police horse helps Constable Mark Rodriguez to deal with his difficult past.
display.title: Holding Fast

display.subtitle2: Lou doubts her choice to live and work at Heartland when a group of corporate career women arrives for a weekend retreat.
display.title: Corporate Cowgirls

display.subtitle2: Amy achieves stardom when a video of her saving a traumatized horse is posted on the Internet in the Season 3 opener.
display.title: Miracle

display.subtitle2: A family crisis engulfs Amy when she tries to help a girl and her horse rebound from what appears to have been a freak accident.
display.title: Little Secrets

display.subtitle2: Jack must part with his truck, a cherished piece of his past.
display.title: Man's Best Friend

display.subtitle2: When Amy and Ty discover their eccentric neighbour Mr. Hanley has abandoned his farm, they must work together to save his starving and thirsty horses. When a remorseful Mr. Hanley returns without a good explanation for his absence, Amy is deeply disappointed. Mr. Hanley needs Amy's help to save his family farm, but how can Amy help somebody who willfully abandoned his own horses? Meanwhile, Marnie convinces Lou to join a local association for small business owners in Hudson.
display.title: The Haunting of Hanley Barn

display.subtitle2: A pregnant mare unites Kit and Ty; and Jack and Tim reboot their glory days.
display.title: Glory Days

display.subtitle2: Ty arrives home with Connor, a friend he met on his travels. But the happy homecoming, much anticipated by Amy, is seriously complicated when Connor turns out to be a beautiful girl who may or may not have designs on Ty. The competition between Amy and her rival is played out over a challenging cross-country course. Everyone is busy with his or her own lives and Jack is left to do the bulk of the ranch work.
display.title: Homecoming

display.subtitle2: When Amy works with Nick Harwell's temperamental polo pony she suspects there is more to the horse's behavioural issues than meets the eye. She enlists Ty to help her investigate what's going on at Nick's polo club and they are shocked to discover that Nick is jeopardising his horse's health to win polo games.
display.title: What Dreams May Become

display.subtitle2: When an unspoken attraction re-surfaces, Amy discovers that honesty might be the best policy, but it certainly isnt the easiest one.
display.title: Road Curves

display.subtitle2: Amy faces a difficult life decision when she's offered a full scholarship at a prestigious college. Stressed out, she even contemplates skipping her graduation party. But Ty convinces her to go and she's surprised to find Soraya's grad date is none other than Chase Powers.
display.title: Graduation

display.subtitle2: Amy and Ty convince Sarah Craven, the town recluse, to let them treat her sick (and very old) horse Falcon at Heartland. They learn she has a deep and mysterious connection to Falcon, and as the horse's condition gets worse Amy and Ty must help Sarah deal with the demons of her past.
display.title: Where the Truth Lies

display.subtitle2: Amy is inspired to take her horsemanship to a new level when she works with a professional liberty horse trainer. She realizes she has to return to her roots when it comes to her work with horses and her relationship with Ty. Meanwhile, a leaky roof causes Ty to make a big decision that he thinks will help them grow as a couple. But Amy is very apprehensive; she isn't so sure Ty has made the best choice for their future.
display.title: Finding Freedom

display.subtitle2: When Tim is coerced to go with Jack on a secret mission Amy is left back at Heartland with Janice to get a young racehorse ready for his maiden run. Unfortunately, Amy and Janice butt heads over their opposing methods for training the young racehorse. On the road, Jack forces Tim to talk to Miranda and learns why she doesn't want Shane to have anything to do with Tim, or Heartland for that matter.
display.title: Something In The Night

display.subtitle2: Synopsis: When Tim reveals to the family that Shane is his son it throws everybody for a loop and threatens to ruin the traditional Bartlett-Fleming naming ceremony for Lou's baby. Amy and Lou must deal with the life-changing news that they have a brother, and Shane tries to accept the father, two sisters and baby niece he never knew he had. In the midst of this major revelation Lou also has to contend with her standoffish mother-in-law's first visit to Heartland.
display.title: What's in a Name?

display.subtitle2: Synopsis: When Tim reveals to the family that Shane is his son it throws everybody for a loop and threatens to ruin the traditional Bartlett-Fleming naming ceremony for Lou's baby. Amy and Lou must deal with the life-changing news that they have a brother, and Shane tries to accept the father, two sisters and baby niece he never knew he had. In the midst of this major revelation Lou also has to contend with her standoffish mother-in-law's first visit to Heartland.
display.title: Beyond Hell's Half Mile

display.subtitle2: : Amy helps to restore the confidence of a troubled, young trick-rider so that she can get back on her horse and perform again. Meanwhile, Ty and Amy's plans to raise the spirits of a freshly separated Caleb with a night out on the town go completely awry. And Jack is so fed up with the full house at Heartland, along with the line-ups for the bathroom, that he decides to build an outhouse. Peter gets Jack's hint and comes up with an interesting housing idea for Lou.
display.title: Never Let Go

display.subtitle2: When Phoenix's real owner shows up at Heartland to reclaim him, Georgie pursues him back to his home stables only to discover why the horse ran away in the first place. Meanwhile, Lou blames Amy's dog Lobo for giving Katie fleas until she realizes that the dog isn't the problem.
display.title: Crossed Signals

display.subtitle2: Tim hopes for a big payday when he helps a wealthy weekend cowboy (Lanny) look for his dream ranch, while Amy's stuck teaching his trophy wife (Paige) how to ride. Lou also pushes hard for Lanny's business when she learns he's looking for a new financial advisor. Meanwhile, the stress from Ty's up-coming finals and failed marriage proposal cause him to make an embarrassing gaff at the clinic.
display.title: Keeping Up Appearances

display.subtitle2: Amy tries to fulfill Mallory's dream of being a show jumper but discovers that it's Georgie who has the natural talent. Tim is trying to convince Jack to be his partner in the purchase of a bison bull when Miranda comes to Heartland for a visit and goes on a trail ride with Tim that could totally change their family dynamic.
display.title: The Natural

display.subtitle2: Janice brings Cisco Kid (and her emotional baggage over Tim) to Heartland for Amy to figure out why Cisco's lost that winning feeling. Meanwhile, Georgie makes friends with a stray dog (REMI) and convinces Mallory they need to search for him when he goes missing. And Amy struggles with her jealousy of Ty and Cassandra's budding friendship when Ty makes the mistake by sharing an important letter from vet school with Cassandra first.
display.title: Trial Run

display.subtitle2: Amy is bursting to ask Ty about the engagement ring, and why he hasn't proposed yet, but a couple of runaways throw everything at Heartland into turmoil. Meanwhile, as Lou tries to keep it a secret that she knows about the ring, she and Peter must also cope with the money pit that the Hanley Farm renovation has become. Lou is under so much stress that when things start to go missing around Heartland, she thinks she's losing it.
display.title: Running Against the Wind

display.subtitle2: As the family struggles to cope with recent changes at the ranch, Amy comes to realize she has to focus on returning to her work with horses. Meanwhile, Georgie struggles with her decision to ask Peter to a father/daughter dance and Tim unloads a controversial new moneymaking venture on Heartland.
display.title: Picking Up the Pieces

display.subtitle2: Ty struggles to deal with the fact that Amy has found the engagement ring and has to decide how and whether he is going to propose to her or not. Amy and Ty find the ranch of their dreams, while Peter attempts to mediate when Georgie and Olivia come to blows. And Lou attempts to get Jack to pay attention to his health, but Jack is too busy working with Ty to track down Jack's missing trucks.
display.title: Living the Moment

display.subtitle2: Lou and Tim find themselves on opposite ends of a fight when Tim attempts to rebrand Maggie's into a soulless fast food franchise. Meanwhile, Jack and Georgie help Amy plumb for missing treasure, and Ty unearths the cause of a recent string of horse deaths.
display.title: Wrecking Ball

display.subtitle2: As Amy and Ty work to help a mare and foal through a difficult weaning process, Mallory's discovery that Jake is planning to leave Hudson forces her to re-examine the choices she has made. Meanwhile, Lou hires an old friend to manage her new business venture and Jack and Tim learn that babysitting can be a money-losing proposition.
display.title: The Penny Drops

display.subtitle2: Amy attempts to help a young RCMP constable overcome a personal challenge to fulfil his lifelong dream of performing in the RCMP Musical Ride. Meanwhile, Georgie's initial excitement over her brother's visit quickly wanes when he only has eyes for Cassandra; and, still concerned about her grandfather's health, Lou works to thwart Jack's attempts to bring in the hay.
display.title: Thread the Needle

display.subtitle2: Amy's return from Europe is far from the homecoming she anticipated when she finds herself struggling to integrate back into life at Heartland and her relationship with Ty. Meanwhile, Jack and Lisa have been waiting to reveal their marriage to the family, but discover that finding the right moment to make the announcement is more difficult than expected. And Georgie unearths a secret that will cause her to lose faith in an idol.
display.title: There and Back Again

display.subtitle2: After her initial shock at her grandfather's announcement, Lou throws herself into party planning mode and forces Jack into an awkward reunion with an old acquaintance. Ty becomes the middleman when Amy and Caleb butt heads over horse training. And still reeling from her recent discovery, Georgie pulls away from Amy and focuses on donating money to an online animal sanctuary.
display.title: The Big Red Wall

display.subtitle2: Amy's attempts to reunite with Georgie are continually thwarted by the arrival of lavish gifts from afar. When Tim is captivated by an old acquaintance, he and Jack team up for a charity event. Meanwhile, Lou and Peter disagree about potential pre-schools and Lou takes Katie for an assessment. And an unexpected revelation forces Ty to question his career prospects.
display.title: Severed Ties

display.subtitle2: A surprise visitor at Heartland makes an unwelcome declaration and Amy is forced to deal with the devastating consequences. Meanwhile, a dire animal crisis at the Reserve eerily parallels Ty's personal life when he realizes that some things just can't be saved. Still stinging from Katie's pre-school rejection, Lou's insistence that a specialist test her daughter brings an unexpected result. And Georgie realizes she needs her own trick riding horse in order to keep up with her nemesis Olivia.
display.title: Secrets and Lies

display.subtitle2: Amy struggles to turn a pair of horses into a team, and is forced to go head-to-head with a rival trainer. Meanwhile, Ty discovers a dead bear on the Reserve with its gallbladder missing but when he begins asking too many questions, poachers threaten his life. When Ty asks Georgie to care for an orphan wolf pup, she sees it as an opportunity to reunite Amy and Ty.
display.title: Endings and Beginnings

display.subtitle2: While a dangerous bear lurks near Heartland, Amy and Georgie rescue an injured horse from the woods. Newlyweds Amy and Ty work together to nurse the animal back to health. When Jack returns from Arizona he takes Tim to task for his lack of progress on the loft renovations, forcing Tim to accept that he needs help. Meanwhile, Lou and Peter's sensible separation negotiations turn sour and to Georgie's dismay escalate into conflict over visitation rights.
display.title: Brave New World

display.subtitle2: Jack grapples with the impending loss of a loyal and trusted friend. And in a desperate bid to relieve Paint's arthritis and extend his life, Ty focuses on medical treatments while Amy uses every herbal and physical therapy she's learned. Meanwhile, Georgie deals with her new math tutor, a brilliant but arrogant boy from her school.
display.title: Ties Of The Earth

display.subtitle2: Ty prepares to celebrate an important milestone as he and Amy treat an abandoned horse. Synopsis: As Ty prepares to celebrate an important milestone, he works to treat an abandoned horse's Rain Rot while Amy focuses on how to heal the animal's emotional scars. Meanwhile, Jack uses a supposed arthritic knee as an excuse to justify his unwillingness to ride, but Tim eventually realizes that Jack is grappling with the retirement of a trusted friend.
display.title: Begin Again

display.subtitle2: After enlisting Amy to help her perfect a trick to perform at an upcoming rodeo, Georgie gets pulled away by Lou and Peter who insist she focus on her schoolwork. Meanwhile, Tim coaches Jade as she prepares to enter her first rodeo, despite opposition from her mother. And Ty receives an offer that may jeopardize his work with Amy.
display.title: Riding for a Fall

display.subtitle2: As Amy and Georgie prepare to compete in a cowboy competition, Georgie guilts Jack into helping her train on a new horse in the hopes he will fall in love with the animal. Meanwhile, Peter helps Tim with the loft renovation and they are forced to find common ground on the issue of the separation. And when Ty and Amy can't find a place for a coyote pup to convalesce, Ty is forced to take Bob up on his offer to help.
display.title: Back in the Saddle

display.subtitle2: Ty performs life-saving surgery on a mare, while Amy and the family work around-the-clock to bottle feed the mare's twin foals. Meanwhile, Georgie's new coach overhears Georgie confront Sam when she suspects her of sabotage during an Extreme Team practice, and Sam blames Georgie when she loses her headliner status. Forced together on a trail ride, Lou and Mitch come to terms with their mutual attraction and Lou reaches a decision about her future.
display.title: You Just Know

display.subtitle2: Tim is caught in the middle of Jade's showdown with a new hotshot bronc rider. Meanwhile, Georgie is feeling trapped in a rivalry of her own with Adam. Amy and Jack work with a top-flight bronc that has lost his mojo, while Ty faces a dilemma when a new professional passion project threatens to upend his life with Amy. And old feelings are rekindled when Casey enlists Tim's help with a new rodeo school student.
display.title: New Kid In Town

display.subtitle2: When Amy and Ty reach a difficult decision about their future, the Heartland family grapples with the implications of their choice. Meanwhile, Georgie and Jade convince Tim to hire them to work at Maggie's, and Ty and Amy work together to save Casey's barrel racing horse.
display.title: New Horizons

display.subtitle2: When one of Tim's team-building events turns competitive, Georgie gets stuck partnering with Jade's cocky rival. Meanwhile, Amy and Cass have a falling out over Ty's partnership at the vet clinic until a close call forces them to reconcile. And Jack offers to help Tim with mounted orienteering in order to avoid lunch with Lisa's uppity aunt.
display.title: Something To Prove

display.subtitle2: When Amy helps a mounted archer reconnect with her horse, she also unravels the mystery behind Spartan's recent behavior. Meanwhile, Georgie is keen to tackle an exciting new challenge but her relationship with Adam is tested when he finds her spending time with another guy. Hoping they will finally have a chance to talk, Lou is surprised by Mitch's reaction when she unexpectedly descends on his solo fishing trip.
display.title: The Green-Eyed Monster

display.subtitle2: When Lou is given a horse, Amy helps her sister nurture a connection with the animal while Lou wrestles with the implications of the unexpected gift. Meanwhile, a crisis at the Wildlife Reserve brings Georgie and Adam together and provokes them to take a risk. And when Jack faces a deadly threat it prompts Mitch to come clean about his past.
display.title: Riding Shotgun

display.subtitle2: Jack discovers the true reason behind his friend's visit. Amy is compelled to intervene when the new Extreme Team coach pits Georgie and her teammates against each other. Jade's newfound status from a sponsorship deal goes to her head.
display.title: Here And Now

display.subtitle2: An out-of-town horse clinic takes a dangerous turn for Amy, Tim and Georgie. Meanwhile, Lou's flight home is delayed and Jack is caught in the middle when Mitch's elevated status at Heartland begins to make Peter feel like an outsider. And when an endangered bear is shot by poachers Ty and Bob fight to save its life.
display.title: A Horse With No Rider

display.subtitle2: While Amy deals with a panicked horse trapped in a trailer, Georgie heads off on a desperate search for Tim. Meanwhile, Bob and Ty tackle a difficult surgery to save an endangered bear cub's life. When Amy, Tim and Georgie are late returning from a clinic, Jack and Mitch head off to find them. And with the help of Lou and his girls, Peter makes a choice that assures his place in the Heartland family.
display.title: Together And Apart

display.subtitle2: As Amy and Ty prepare for parenthood, they work together to resolve a dangerous pregnancy issue. Meanwhile.
display.title: There Will Be Changes
